Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student may draw two students holding something that might represent a string or cups (e.g., a simple line connecting them).
The student might use colors or shapes to imply communication but without clarity (e.g., lines or circles near the students).
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to correctly illustrate how the string telephone works (e.g., may not draw the cups or string properly connected or depicted at all).
The student may not show how sound travels through the string (e.g., no indication of vibration or sound waves).
The student may not use the designated materials correctly (e.g., drawing a wire instead of a string, or not using cups).
The student may not include features for sending or receiving information (e.g., speaking or listening parts of the cups are not evident or accurately depicted).
The student might not understand the concept of communication over distance or fail to illustrate it meaningfully (e.g., drawing the two students too close together or without a clear purpose).
